result.execSummary:
The defendant Keelen M McAdoo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keelen M McAdoo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Court will consider expungement upon successful completion of terms of probation.

Defendant Keelen M McAdoo in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Keelen M McAdoo in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

As to Counts 1 and 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties. 
As to Count 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 months in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of 67 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work and school.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years.  

As to Count 3:  Defendant ordered to serve 30 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of 30 days time served.  A time served dispostiion. 

Conditions of Probation: 
 - Defendant is to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, condition time, with Huber Privileges for work and school. 
 - Undergo a mental health evaluation; follow through with any treatment recommended. 
 - Maintain full time employment or attend school.  
 - No contact with Mark M. 
 - Pay restitution to Mark M. in the amount of $1150.00 and to Milwaukee Police Department in the amount of $199.66, by 9-01-2016 or civil judgment. 
 - Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges, during term of probation or civil judgment.

Court will consider expungement upon successful completion of terms of probation. 

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Keelen M McAdoo in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Keelen M McAdoo in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

NO FILE IN COURT.
Defense has just received the negotiation and request an adjournment.    Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 33.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. Court preapproved transfer to branch 6 if accepted for global resolution.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Keelen M McAdoo not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED by the Court. Bail: $500.00 to remain.
Per defense attorney, a Bail/Bond Hearing will be scheduled on 6/30/2015 at 8:30am. Parties notified.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court previously.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Case adjourned to 7/28/2015 at 8:30 am for a Plea Hearing. Awaiting possible DPA with cases 15CM1560 and 14CM4693.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Due to pending matters in another court, case adjourned to branch 47 on 6/24/2015 at 8:30 am.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Keelen M McAdoo not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 47. lr  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 06-23-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  MARK M. OR HIS RESIDENCE.
 Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Keelen M McAdoo in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Keelen M McAdoo in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
